```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from pathlib import Path
import sys

# Find the project root dynamically
project_root = Path.cwd()
if project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health':
    while project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health' and project_root.parent != project_root:
        project_root = project_root.parent

# Add brain/figures to path for imports
sys.path.insert(0, str(project_root / 'brain' / 'figures'))

# Import centralized style
from _chart_style import setup_chart_style, add_watermark, COLOR_BLACK, COLOR_WHITE
from _chart_style import PATTERN_DIAGONAL, PATTERN_HORIZONTAL, PATTERN_CROSS, PATTERN_DOTS

setup_chart_style()

# Data: Two segments to show the stark contrast
categories = [
    'Actually Testing Treatments\n$2.5B',
    'Everything Else\n(Buildings, Admin, Training, Basic Research)\n$48.5B'
]

values = [2.5, 48.5]  # Billions
colors = [COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_WHITE]  # Both white fills
hatches = [None, PATTERN_DIAGONAL]  # No pattern for trials, diagonal for everything else

# Create figure
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))

# Create pie chart with patterns - start with the small slice at top
wedges, texts, autotexts = ax.pie(
    values,
    labels=categories,
    autopct='%1.0f%%',
    colors=colors,
    wedgeprops={'edgecolor': COLOR_BLACK, 'linewidth': 3},
    textprops={'fontsize': 16, 'weight': 'bold', 'color': COLOR_BLACK},
    startangle=90,
    explode=(0.1, 0)  # Slightly separate the human trials slice to emphasize it
)

# Add patterns to wedges
for wedge, hatch in zip(wedges, hatches):
    wedge.set_hatch(hatch)

# Make percentage text larger and bold
for autotext in autotexts:
    autotext.set_fontsize(24)
    autotext.set_weight('bold')
    autotext.set_color(COLOR_BLACK)

# Add title
plt.title('NIH Budget: Where Your $51 Billion Goes',
         fontsize=26, weight='bold', pad=20, color=COLOR_BLACK)

# Add watermark
add_watermark(fig)

# Adjust layout to remove white space
plt.tight_layout()

# Save the figure
output_dir = project_root / 'brain' / 'figures'
output_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
plt.savefig(output_dir / 'nih-budget-allocation-pie-chart.png',
            dpi=200, bbox_inches='tight', facecolor=COLOR_WHITE)

plt.show()
```
